### ACAN: Toxicity of Priority Technology-Critical Elements in Freshwater Invertebrates

#### Tender Details
* Tender Reference Number: cb-726-19596917
* Solicitation Number: 5000083320
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-11-29T14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-12-16
* Expected Contract End Date: 2027-03-22

#### Description of the Requirement
Environment and Climate Change Canada requires a contractor to develop methods for the analysis of priority technology-critical elements, assess their acute and chronic toxicity, and analyze water and snail tissue samples in support of collaborative work.

#### Scope of Work
The scope of work includes:

* Method development and optimization for water and tissue assays
* Conducting acute and chronic toxicity tests with Daphnia magna, following OECD protocols
* Analyzing aqueous samples from toxicity tests and extracting and analyzing snail tissues
* Delivering toxicity tests results, as well as chemical analysis results, to the technical authority

#### Criteria for Assessment of the Statement of Capabilities
To be considered for the contract, the contractor must demonstrate the following essential requirements:

* Develop methods and capacity for acute and chronic toxicity testing with Daphnia magna
* Follow OECD protocols for testing
* Possess in-house capacity to analyze technology-critical elements in aqueous matrices by ICP-OES and graphite furnace spectrophotometry
* Possess in-house capacity to develop analysis of technology-critical elements in tissues and shells by ICP-OES and graphite furnace spectrophotometry
